headline.main: PROCEEDINGS OF THE LEGISLATURE.; SENATE. BILLS REPORTED FAVORABLY. BILLS INTRODUCED. BILLS PASSED.

MISSOURI.; THE CHOCTAWS. SOUTH CAROLINA THE TREATMENT OF NEGROES AT FORT MONROE. BURNSIDE'S FLEET. REORGANIZING THE ARMY. VIRGINIA LEGISLATURE. GEN. PILLOW AGAIN IN SERVICE. THE METHODISTS. C.S. DISTRICT COURT. AN OLD BORDER RUFFIAN. MISCELLANEOUS ITEMS.

docs.snippet: In the Senate yesterday, the bill in relation to the punishment of crime in certain cases was reported favorably by the Prison Committee, which also recommended an alteration in the terms for sending criminals to the State Prisons, and in the law...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate yesterday, the bill in relation to the punishment of crime in certain cases was reported favorably by the Prison Committee, which also recommended an alteration in the terms for sending criminals to the State Prisons, and in the law relative to the commutation of sentences. The report of the Select Committee, appointed at the last session, to investigate charges of malfeasance brought against certain Harbor-masters, was presented and ordered to be printed.

headline.main: NEWS FROM ALBANY.; Misunderstanding About Saturday's Adjournment Action on the Bright Resolutions The Inspection of Steam Boilers A Metropolitan Board of Health Extension of Streets in New-York A Proposed Law for the Protection of Witnesses, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some misunderstanding seems to have prevailed as to what time the Senate adjourned to on Satur day. Several of the Senators went home, supposing it was until Monday evening, but those who were here met in the morning. Nothing of especial inter est, however, transpired. The vote on the Bright resolutions, as amended and mollified, was postponed until 1 o'clock to-day, for the benefit of the absentees.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH SALTING THE STREETS. The Commissioners of Health held a special meeting yesterday at the Mayor's Office, called at the instance of several of the railroad and stage proprietors, with reference to the salting of the streets....
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH SALTING THE STREETS. The Commissioners of Health held a special meeting yesterday at the Mayor's Office, called at the instance of several of the railroad and stage proprietors, with reference to the salting of the streets. Affidavits were presented by those opposed to the measure, tending to show its disastrous consequences to horses, in one stable alone, one hundred...

docs.snippet: A gentleman who fortherly resided in this city, but has lived in the South for eighteen months past, arrived in town yesterday from Memphis, which place he left on Sunday, Jan. 19. In an interview with his we learned the following facts.
